title: War in Ukraine: How Russia adapted its winter strategy
description: Moscow's forces have adapted their tactics since last winter, preceding their missiles with waves of drones, whose mission is to saturate Kyiv's air defense capabilities and deplete their ammunition reserves.

title: Tortured migrants cared for at Palermo hospital
description: A specialized medical service is helping asylum seekers who have fallen into the hands of traffickers on their way to Europe.

title: Storm Henk causes flooding and travel disruption in UK
description: Hundreds of flood warnings were in place after strong winds and rain lashed large parts of the country, hitting travel and cutting power.

title: Manchester United co-owner billionaire Jim Ratcliffe's insatiable appetite for sport
description: Having acquired a quarter of the famous soccer club, the British businessman continues his expansion, from sailing to cycling and marathon running.

title: Argentina arrests suspected Yemen-linked 'terrorist cell'
description: The three foreigners, citizens of Syria and Lebanon, were arrested by Argentina's federal police under suspicions of planning a 'terrorist act,' as the country hosts a pan-American Jewish sporting event.

title: French cinema split over the case of Gérard Depardieu
description: Many letters and op-eds exposed a major split in French cinema about the case of the actor, a film icon now charged with rape and sexual assault.

title: Assassination of a Hamas leader in Beirut sparks fears of regional conflict
description: A drone strike attributed to Israel targeted the deputy chairman of Hamas' political bureau, Saleh al-Arouri. He had been living in exile in a Hezbollah stronghold within Beirut.

title: Iran says at least 53 people killed in blasts at ceremony honoring slain general Soleimani
description: Two deadly blasts occurred near the grave of Revolutionary Guards general Qassem Soleimani, Iranian state television said Wednesday.

title: Republicans claim victory after resignation of Harvard president Claudine Gay
description: Criticized for her answers on anti-Semitism at a Congressional hearing after Hamas's attacks on Israel, the first Black president of the prestigious institution was also accused of plagiarism in her doctoral thesis.

title: Yotam Ottolenghi: 'A cuisine is never static'
description: The British-Israeli chef, head of seven establishments in London, plans to open a deli restaurant in Paris. His bestseller 'Jerusalem' is an ode to mixed-race cuisine co-written with Palestinian Sami Tamimi.

title: 'Hybrid war knows no peace any more than Putin knows good faith'
description: To put an end to the war in Ukraine, insistent voices in the US suggest that Russia is ready to negotiate. This overlooks Vladimir Putin's track record in negotiations, explains Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: English doctors begin longest-ever NHS strike
description: Junior doctors in England have begun a six-day walkout, the longest consecutive strike in the National Health Service's history, citing uneven pay rises between doctor grades, meaning 'pay cuts for many doctors.'

title: 'Priscilla': Portrait of a young girl under the influence of Elvis Presley
description: Sofia Coppola weaves the story of a teenage girl locked in a gilded cage by an abusive star.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #1 France's sleeping volcanoes
description: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 1: Cycling among endless volcanic sleeping beauties.

title: 'Made in Abbey' products thrive as consumers increasingly favor ethical goods
description: Relying on local sourcing and designed with respect for the needs of people and the environment, the production model in monasteries echoes the current debate over the role of business and the workplace.

title: Death toll in Japan earthquake rises to 62 as weather hinders rescue effort
description: Nearly 32,000 people are currently in shelters as heavy rain threatens the area.

title: US-led multi-national force faces Houthi attacks in Red Sea
description: Iran has deployed a warship in the wake of a deadly confrontation between the US military and Yemeni rebels in what is a vital shipping route for global commerce.

title: Cryptocurrency: After a 2023 full of scandals and ups and downs, the appetite for bitcoin is growing
description: The main cryptoassets have seen their prices rebound in recent months, starting with bitcoin, which is in the process of being selected as an investment vehicle by world-class asset managers.

title: Macron tells Israel to avoid escalation, 'particularly in Lebanon'
description: The warning came after an Israeli air strike in Beirut killed seven members of Hezbollah and Hamas, including the Palestinian group's deputy leader Salah al-Arouri.
